weaponProfile.title: Firewall
weaponProfile.specialAbility: A fully charged shot deals massive Thermal damage and applies the 'Cyberware Malfunction' quickhack to all enemies in a cone.

manufacturingIntel.creator: Netwatch Cyber-Warfare R&D Division
manufacturingIntel.creatorReputation: Netwatch doesn't build weapons; they define threats. The Firewall was a solution commissioned from Tetratronic to a specific problem: how to non-lethally neutralize a high-threat, cybernetically-enhanced individual without blowing them to pieces. The project lead was a former cyberpsycho-squad survivor who believed that a 'system crash' was more effective than a bullet.
manufacturingIntel.developmentHistory: The Firewall was developed as Netwatch's primary tool for dealing with rogue netrunners and early-stage cyberpsychos. It's not a shotgun in the traditional sense. It doesn't fire projectiles. Instead, a fully charged shot releases a focused, conical blast of high-intensity microwaves and thermal energy. This 'firewall' of energy is designed to instantly overwhelm and reboot most commercial cyberware, effectively flash-frying implants and causing a system-wide malfunction. It's a weapon that attacks the chrome, not the person.

strengths: The ultimate anti-cyberware weapon, capable of disabling entire groups of heavily chromed enemies.
Applies a powerful quickhack without requiring a cyberdeck or RAM.
Exceptional for crowd control and creating tactical openings in a firefight.
Provides a reliable, area-of-effect method for non-lethal neutralization.
weaknesses: Almost zero physical damage, making it completely useless against unaugmented targets or environmental objects.
The charge-up mechanic makes it slow and difficult to use in fast-paced, reactive combat.
Possession of this weapon is highly illegal and will be treated as stolen Netwatch property by the NCPD.
tacticalAssessment.recommendedRoles: Cyberpsycho Hunter, Non-lethal Specialist, Techie, Field Control.
tacticalAssessment.masteryArchetype: A 'System Administrator' build. An operative focused on Intelligence and Technical Ability who views combat as a series of systems to be controlled and exploited. The ideal user combines the Firewall with debilitating quickhacks, using the shotgun to 'crash' a group of enemies before picking them apart with precision attacks or non-lethal takedowns. They don't win firefights; they de-escalate them, forcefully.

acquisitionIntel.marketAvailability: Effectively zero. This is a restricted, proprietary tool issued exclusively to Netwatch field agents. It is never sold, legally or otherwise. The only way to acquire one is to take it from a Netwatch agent—a move that will put you at the top of their most-wanted list.
acquisitionIntel.rumoredLocation: A Netwatch agent went dark while investigating rogue AI activity in Pacifica. It's rumored the Voodoo Boys captured him and are currently attempting to reverse-engineer his Firewall in their main server hub, deep within the Grand Imperial Mall. They would see its anti-cyberware tech as a profound threat.

fieldTestimonials.context: Reviewing after-action report from a cyberpsycho gig.
fieldTestimonials.feedback: 'The operative used a Firewall. The target, a Maelstrom ganger with 80% chrome conversion, was neutralized without a single fatal wound. His combat implants were slagged, but his organic systems were stable. This weapon is a miracle of de-escalation technology. I need more of them.'

'I tried to use this fancy light-show against some V-boys. The ones with chrome arms and fancy eyes went down twitching, sure. But the guys with just a pistol and a bad attitude? It barely tickled them. This isn't a weapon; it's a very expensive and very specific can opener. Not for a real soldier.'

'This... this is beautiful. It's a quickhack that you can hold in your hands. It doesn't just damage; it communicates with their chrome on a fundamental level and tells it to *stop*. It's the ultimate expression of a netrunner's philosophy: why break the body when you can simply crash the system?'
